intro: Tithymalus aulacospermus, commonly known as the golden tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Tithymalus aulacospermus is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
